data.title: The Internal Reversal
data.solution:
sentence = input()

words = sentence[:-1].split()

for n in range(len(words)):
    w_reversed = words[n].lower()[::-1]
    
    if words[n][0].isupper():
        w_reversed = w_reversed.title()
        
    words[n] = w_reversed

print(" ".join(words[::-1]) + sentence[-1])

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your task is to write a program that takes a single input sentence and reverses it following these rules:

1) The word order gets reversed
2) The characters in each word get reversed
3) Upper-case words stay upper-case, for example Hello becomes Olleh
4) A sentence ends with a period, a semicolon, a question mark or an exclamation mark and does not include any other punctuation.

Example:

This is an Example.

will become

Elpmaxe na si Siht.
Input
Line 1: A string sentence to be reversed
Output
The reversed sentence, following the rules stated above.
Constraints
2 ≤ length(sentence) ≤ 256
Example
Input
a simple sentence.
Output
ecnetnes elpmis a.
